title: Smart Scan - Download

body.body: Clicking the Download button in the top navigation menu will display the Download page.
From this page, it is possible to automatically download calibration updates to all motorcycle ECMs with one simple workflow.
ECM calibration files are automatically selected and downloaded based on the model and market variant identified during the initial scan.
The Smart Scan Download feature automatically optimises the download process so that only calibrations (or calibration components) that are absolutely necessary are downloaded to the motorcycle.
This ensures that the time taken to download calibrations is minimised wherever possible.
The Download page provides details of the connected motorcycle, and a list of ECMs that can be updated.

body.name: Smart Scan - Download Page - Updates Available

body.body: Always ensure that the correct motorcycle model is displayed before starting calibration downloads.
Downloading calibrations for an incorrect model may cause motorcycle electronic systems to function incorrectly.
This can cause an unsafe riding condition which could lead to an accident resulting in injury or death.
Always ensure that the correct motorcycle market variant is identified and displayed before starting calibration downloads.
Downloading calibrations for an incorrect market variant may cause motorcycle electrical or electronic systems to function incorrectly for your region.
Check that the model and market variant details are correct before starting any downloads.
The ECMs listed are colour coded based on availability of calibration updates:
Each ECM is provided with a toggle switch. The toggle switches are automatically set based on the availability of calibration updates:
Update available (Red) - Toggle switch On (right) position - Update ECM.
ECM up to date (Green) - Toggle switch Off (left) position - Do not update ECM
The toggle switches can be adjusted to allow you to choose which ECMs you wish to download calibration updates to.
An estimated download time is displayed at the bottom left of the screen.
The estimated download time provides best case and worst case estimates based on the ECMs selected for update, and on the calibration components that will be downloaded.
The download time is automatically adjusted when ECMs are selected or deselected for update.
When you have selected the ECMs you wish to update, click the
button at the bottom right of the screen to continue.
The Download Confirmation screen is displayed. Read and follow all instructions provided.
to start the calibration downloads, or click
to return to the start screen.
After clicking Start, the tool will automatically start downloading calibrations to the selected ECMs.
The tool will display the download progress for each ECM being updated, and the estimated download time remaining.
While downloads are in progress, the Current Status bar will be coloured amber, and the message DOWNLOAD IN PROGRESS will be displayed.
The estimated remaining download time will reduce after each ECM download has completed.
You may be instructed to perform actions between ECM downloads, such as:
- Turn the ignition Off and On.
- Switch the Engine Stop Switch to the RUN or STOP position.
We have made every effort to position these actions as early as possible in the download workflow. This to minimise interactions and attendance required from the user during the download process.
These actions are typically required after Engine ECM or ABS downloads have completed.
A cancel button is provided to allow you to cancel the download process.
, the tool will abort the download process after the ECM currently being updated has completed its download.
When all downloads are complete, the current status bar will change to green, and the message DOWNLOAD COMPLETE will be displayed.
After clicking NEXT, the tool will perform a full motorcycle re-scan before returning to the Smart Scan Summary page.
All ECMs should now be reported as up to date.
Downloading calibration updates can cause DTCs to be stored on some ECMs. After completing downloads, go to the DTCs page and erase any stored DTCs.
If an ECM download fails for any reason, a red cross and the message Download Failed will be displayed on the affected ECM.
The tool will continue to download to any other ECMs which have calibration downloads pending.
When all pending downloads have completed, the Current Status bar will be coloured red, and the message DOWNLOAD FAILED will be displayed.
In some cases, the motorcycle ignition will need to be switched off for up to 120 seconds to allow a full power down before a recovery download can be attempted.
Follow the onscreen instructions and turn the motorcycle ignition Off for the required time period.
Turn the ignition ON, then click
The tool will perform a full motorcycle rescan.
When prompted, confirm your Model and Market Variant as described in
Smart Scan - Motorcycle Model and Market Variant Confirmation
Upon confirming the Model and Market Variant you will be returned to the Summary page.
Any ECMs affected by a download failure will be coloured Red, and may report as Not Connected.
In most cases, it is possible to recover failed downloads using the Smart Scan Download feature.
After returning to the Smart Scan Summary page, navigate to the Download page.
Any ECMs affected by a download failure will be shown in red, and may report as Not Connected. The toggle switch for each affected ECM will be automatically set to the "Update position".
Simply click Start and follow the standard download process.

If attempts to start a recovery download fail when using the Smart Scan Download page, an alternative download recovery method is provided in the Download area located on the diagnostic tool Main Menu.
Updates to the Main Menu Download Area

search: Smart Scan - Download
Clicking the Download button in the top navigation menu will display the Download page.
From this page, it is possible to automatically download calibration updates to all motorcycle ECMs with one simple workflow.
ECM calibration files are automatically selected and downloaded based on the model and market variant identified during the initial scan.
The Smart Scan Download feature automatically optimises the download process so that only calibrations (or calibration components) that are absolutely necessary are downloaded to the motorcycle.
This ensures that the time taken to download calibrations is minimised wherever possible.
The Download page provides details of the connected motorcycle, and a list of ECMs that can be updated.
Always ensure that the correct motorcycle model is displayed before starting calibration downloads.
Downloading calibrations for an incorrect model may cause motorcycle electronic systems to function incorrectly.
This can cause an unsafe riding condition which could lead to an accident resulting in injury or death.
Always ensure that the correct motorcycle market variant is identified and displayed before starting calibration downloads.
Downloading calibrations for an incorrect market variant may cause motorcycle electrical or electronic systems to function incorrectly for your region.
Check that the model and market variant details are correct before starting any downloads.
The ECMs listed are colour coded based on availability of calibration updates:
Red - Update available.
Green - Up to date
Each ECM is provided with a toggle switch. The toggle switches are automatically set based on the availability of calibration updates:
Update available (Red) - Toggle switch On (right) position - Update ECM.
ECM up to date (Green) - Toggle switch Off (left) position - Do not update ECM
The toggle switches can be adjusted to allow you to choose which ECMs you wish to download calibration updates to.
An estimated download time is displayed at the bottom left of the screen.
The estimated download time provides best case and worst case estimates based on the ECMs selected for update, and on the calibration components that will be downloaded.
The download time is automatically adjusted when ECMs are selected or deselected for update.
When you have selected the ECMs you wish to update, click the
DOWNLOAD
button at the bottom right of the screen to continue.
The Download Confirmation screen is displayed. Read and follow all instructions provided.
Click
START
to start the calibration downloads, or click
CANCEL
to return to the start screen.
After clicking Start, the tool will automatically start downloading calibrations to the selected ECMs.
The tool will display the download progress for each ECM being updated, and the estimated download time remaining.
While downloads are in progress, the Current Status bar will be coloured amber, and the message DOWNLOAD IN PROGRESS will be displayed.
The estimated remaining download time will reduce after each ECM download has completed.
You may be instructed to perform actions between ECM downloads, such as:
- Turn the ignition Off and On.
- Switch the Engine Stop Switch to the RUN or STOP position.
- Remove the ABS fuse.
We have made every effort to position these actions as early as possible in the download workflow. This to minimise interactions and attendance required from the user during the download process.
These actions are typically required after Engine ECM or ABS downloads have completed.
Follow any onscreen instructions.
A cancel button is provided to allow you to cancel the download process.
Upon clicking
CANCEL
, the tool will abort the download process after the ECM currently being updated has completed its download.
When all downloads are complete, the current status bar will change to green, and the message DOWNLOAD COMPLETE will be displayed.
Click
NEXT
to continue.
After clicking NEXT, the tool will perform a full motorcycle re-scan before returning to the Smart Scan Summary page.
All ECMs should now be reported as up to date.
Downloading calibration updates can cause DTCs to be stored on some ECMs. After completing downloads, go to the DTCs page and erase any stored DTCs.
See
Smart Scan - DTCs
Failed Downloads and Download Recovery
If an ECM download fails for any reason, a red cross and the message Download Failed will be displayed on the affected ECM.
The tool will continue to download to any other ECMs which have calibration downloads pending.
When all pending downloads have completed, the Current Status bar will be coloured red, and the message DOWNLOAD FAILED will be displayed.
In some cases, the motorcycle ignition will need to be switched off for up to 120 seconds to allow a full power down before a recovery download can be attempted.
Follow the onscreen instructions and turn the motorcycle ignition Off for the required time period.
Turn the ignition ON, then click
NEXT
The tool will perform a full motorcycle rescan.
When prompted, confirm your Model and Market Variant as described in
Smart Scan - Motorcycle Model and Market Variant Confirmation
Upon confirming the Model and Market Variant you will be returned to the Summary page.
Any ECMs affected by a download failure will be coloured Red, and may report as Not Connected.
Download Recovery
In most cases, it is possible to recover failed downloads using the Smart Scan Download feature.
After returning to the Smart Scan Summary page, navigate to the Download page.
Any ECMs affected by a download failure will be shown in red, and may report as Not Connected. The toggle switch for each affected ECM will be automatically set to the "Update position".
Simply click Start and follow the standard download process.

If attempts to start a recovery download fail when using the Smart Scan Download page, an alternative download recovery method is provided in the Download area located on the diagnostic tool Main Menu.

Updates to the Main Menu Download Area
